TextFlow.p: Your writing should not be informal unless you are writing an informal letter or email.
Have you used any words that are too informal?
If you are not sure, check in the dictionary and do not use anything marked informal, slang or spoken.
Avoid short forms. For example, do not write I’m or haven’t, but use I am or have not.

Too many short sentences can sound very informal. To express your ideas you will need to use words like which, that (relative pronouns), and, but, or and although, because, if to join parts of sentences. Avoid very long sentences as these can be difficult to understand.
